definitions.text: a band that fits around the neck and is usually folded over
(zoology) an encircling band or marking around the neck of any animal
anything worn or placed about the neck
examples: the thief was forced to wear a heavy wooden collar
a collar of flowers was placed about the neck of the winning horse

definitions.text: a short ring fastened over a rod or shaft to limit, guide, or secure a machine part
the stitching that forms the rim of a shoe or boot
a band of leather or rope that is placed around an animal's neck as a harness or to identify it
necklace that fits tightly around a woman's neck

examples: asked for a collar on program trading in the stock market
kept a tight leash on his emotions
he's always gotten a long leash

definitions.text: the act of apprehending (especially apprehending a criminal)
examples: the policeman on the beat got credit for the collar
the police nabbed the suspected criminals

definitions.text: seize by the neck or collar
